API¶

class questradeapi.Session(refresh_token)¶

A QuestradeAPI session. It contains information that allows to send requests to the Questrade API.

get_access_data()¶

Returns the data required to access the server, namely a access token and the api server’s address in a tuple.

If the access token is expired, the refresh token is redeemed.

redeem_refresh_token()¶

Redeems the given refresh token to the questrade login server and returnes the received data.

do_get(endpoint, params={})¶

Performs a GET request to the Questrade API.

Parameters:
  • endpoint (str) – The webservice endpoint te request is sent to.
  • params (dict, optional) – The parameters to include in the request.
do_post(endpoint, params={})¶

Performs a POST request to the Questrade API.

Parameters:
  • endpoint (str) – The webservice endpoint te request is sent to.
  • params (dict, optional) – The parameters to include in the request.
do_delete(endpoint, params={})¶

Performs a DELETE request to the Questrade API.

Parameters:
  • endpoint (str) – The webservice endpoint te request is sent to.
  • params (dict, optional) – The parameters to include in the request.
get_time()¶

Retrieve current server time.

get_accounts()¶

Retrieves the accounts associated with the user on behalf of which the API client is authorized.

get_positions(id)¶

Retrives positions in a specified account.

Parameters:id (str) – Account number
get_balances(id)¶

Retrieves per-currency and combined balances for a specified account.

Parameters:id (str) – Account number
get_executions(id, start_time=None, end_time=None)¶

Retrieves executions for a specific account.

Parameters:
  • id (str) – Account number
  • start_time (datetime, optional) – Start of the time range. Defaults to today 00:00am.
  • end_time (datetime, optional) – End of the time range. Defaults to todat 11:59pm.
get_orders(id, state_filter=None, start_time=None, end_time=None, order_ids=None)¶

Retrieves orders for a specified account.

Parameters:
  • id (str) – Account number
  • state_filter (str) – ‘All’, ‘Open’ or ‘Closed’. Retreive all, active or closed orders. Defaults to ‘All’.
  • start_time (datetime, optional) – Start of the time range. Defaults to today 00:00am.
  • end_time (datetime, optional) – End of the time range. Defaults to todat 11:59pm.
  • order_ids (int, optional) – Retrieve specific orders details.
get_activities(id, start_time=None, end_time=None)¶

Retrieve account activities, including cash transactons, dividends, trades, etc.

Parameters:
  • id (list of str) – Account number.
  • start_time (datetime, optional) – Start of the time range. Defaults to today 12:00am.
  • end_time (endtime, optional) – End of the time range Defaults to today 11:59pm.
get_symbols(ids=None, id=None)¶

Retrieves detailed information about one or more symbol.

Parameters:
  • name (list of str) – List of symbol names.
  • ids (list of int) – List of symbol ids.
  • id (int) – Internal symbol identifier. Mutually exclusive with ‘ids’ parameter.
  • list of names or ids can be specified, but not both. If 'names' (Either) –
  • specified, it takes precedence over 'ids', which takes precedence (is) –
  • 'id'. (over) –
get_symbols_search(prefix, offset=None)¶

Retrieves symbol(s) using several search criteria.

Parameters:
  • prefix (str) – Prefix of a symbol or any word in the description.
  • offset (int) – Offset in number of records from the beginning of a result set.
get_option_chain(id)¶

Retrieves an option chain for a particular underlying symbol.

Parameters:id (int) – Internal symbol identifier.
get_markets()¶

Retrieves information about supported markets.

get_quotes(id=None, ids=None)¶

Retrieves a single Level 1 market data quote for one or more symbols.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – Internal symbol identifier (mutually exclusive with ‘ids’ argument).
  • ids (list of int) – List of symbol ids.
get_quotes_options(filters=None, ids=None)¶

Retrieves a single Level 1 market data quote and Greek data for one or more option symbols.

get_quotes_strategies(variants)¶

Retrieve a calculated L1 market data quote for a single or many multi-leg strategies.

  • StrategyVariantRequest –
  • (int) -- Variant ID (variantId) –
  • (enum) -- Strategy type (strategy) –
  • (dic list) -- Array of Strategy legs (legs) –
  • StrategyLeg –

get_candles(id, start_time, end_time, interval)¶

Retrieves historical market data in the form of OHLC candlesticks for a specified symbol. This call is limited to returning 2,000 candlesticks in a single response.

Todo

Add link to interval allowed values.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – Internal symbol indentifier.
  • startTime (datetime) – Beginning of the candlestick range.
  • endTime (datetime) – End of the candlestick range.
  • interval (str) – Interval of a single candlestick. Allowed values:
post_order(account_id, symbol_id, quantity, iceberg_quantity, limit_price, stop_price, all_or_none, anonymous, order_type, time_in_force, action, primary_route, secondary_route, order_id=None, impact=False)¶

Allows to place/replace or estimate the impact of an order against a certain account.

Todo

Link to allowed values for order_type, time_in_force, action, primary_route and secondary_route.

Parameters:
  • id (str) – Account number against which the order is submited.
  • order_id (int) – Order id of the order to be replaced.
  • symbol_id (int) – Internal symbol identifier.
  • quantity (int) – Order quantity.
  • iceberg_quantity (int) – Iceberg instruction quantity.
  • limit_price (double) – Limit price.
  • stop_price (double) – Stop price.
  • all_or_none (bool) – Whether all are none is enabled.
  • anonymous (bool) – Wheter anonymous is enabled.
  • order_type (str) – Order type.
  • time_in_force (str) – Time-In-Force.
  • action (str) – Order side.
  • primary_route (str) – Primary route order.
  • secondary_route (str) – Secondary order route.
  • impact (bool) – Calculate impact instead of placing order.
delete_order(order_id)¶

Allows to cancel an existing order.

Arguments: account_id (String) – Account number order_id (Integer) – Internal identifier of the order

post_bracket_order(account_id, symbol_id, primary_route, secondary_route, components, impact=False)¶

Allows to place/replace or estimate the impact of a bracket order against a certain account.

Todo

Parameters:
  • account_id (str) – Account number.
  • symbol_id (int) – Internal symbol identifier.
  • primary_route (str) – Primary order route.
  • secondary_route (str) – Secondary order route.
  • components (list of dict) – List of Bracket Order Components.
  • impact (bool) – Calculate impact instead of placing order.
  • Order Components (Bracket) –
  • (int) -- Order ID of active order, or 0 for new order (orderId) –
  • (double) -- Order quantity (quantity) –
  • (enum) -- Order side (action) –
  • (double) -- Limit price (limitPrice) –
  • (double) -- Stop price (stopPrice) –
  • (enum) -- Order type (orderType) –
  • (enum) -- Order duration (timeInForce) –
  • (enum) -- Type of component (orderClass) –
post_multi_leg_strategy_order(account_id, symbol_id, limit_price, order_type, time_in_force, primary_route, secondary_route, legs, strategy, impact=False)¶

Allows to place/replace or estimate the impact of a multi-leg strategy against a certain account.

  • symbol_id (int) – Internal symbol identifier.
  • limitPrice (double) – Limit price.
  • orderType (str) – Order type.

  • primary_route (str) – Primary order route.
  • secondary_route (str) – Secondary order route.
  • legs (list of dict) – Array of InsertOrderLegData structures.
  • strategy (str) – Strategy type.
  • impact (bool) – Calculate impact instead of placing order.
